title: Geriatric Psychiatry Education Design: Case-Based Participatory Learner-Centered Course

context.prior_knowledge: Basic medical knowledge (physiology, pathology) and introductory psychiatry concepts
context.additional_context: Large-scale undergraduate psychiatric gerontology education conducted in smartphone-centric limited technological environments. Measuring learning effectiveness through project-based assessments

learning_goals: Identify and explain at least three major neuropsychiatric symptoms commonly seen in elderly patients, such as depression and dementia.
Analyze real clinical cases to specify multidisciplinary approaches to addressing mental health issues in elderly patients.
Collaboratively complete and submit case analysis projects with peer learners using an LMS platform.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
